              WORK CONTEXT
              
              The World Mosquito Program (WMP) is a not-for-profit initiative that works to protect the global community from mosquito-borne diseases such as dengue, Zika and chikungunya. Known until recently as the Eliminate Dengue Program, the WMP uses naturally occurring bacteria called Wolbachia to reduce the ability of mosquitoes to transmit these viruses. Accumulating evidence is supportive of very large impact on disease transmission and large clinical trials and demonstration projects are currently underway.
              
              Following many years of laboratory research and field trials with promising results, the WMP has expanded to 12 countries worldwide and has widespread support from communities, governments and regulators. The World Mosquito Program has two regional hubs – our Asia hub in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, and Oceania hub, based at Monash University in Melbourne, Australia. As well as supporting projects in Vietnam, Sri Lanka, India and Indonesia, our Asia hub contributes to core global operations.
              
              The World Mosquito Program is working in partnership with Action on Poverty to protect communities in Vietnam from mosquito-borne diseases.
              

              JOB PURPOSE SUMMARY
              
              The Marketing and Communications Adviser applies high-level marketing, communications and branding expertise to provide a range of specialist advisory services related to the effective delivery of the World Mosquito Program (WMP) branding and marketing materials.  This includes liaising with external stakeholders, developing a range of communication and marketing strategies, providing expert advice, recommendations and reports to support new initiatives and business decision-making.  The position also manages a range of high quality services including internal and external communications and digital communications and works closely with global project sites and agencies to manage the WMP brand globally. The role provides strategic advice to ensure that the brand is positioned globally as a leader in the sector.
              

              The Marketing and Communications Adviser works closely with the global project sites to ensure campaigns are effective and that branding and communications are aligned with strategy and meet required timeframes, budgets, objectives and quality measures.
              

              AUTHORITY
              
              Reporting Line: The position reports to the Global Marketing and Communications Manager under broad direction, working with a high degree of autonomy.
              

              KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
              
              1.	Manage the development and implementation of branding, marketing, communications, and promotional strategies for the World Mosquito Program, ensuring alignment with the direction of its operational plans and annual priorities
              
              2.	Manage all aspects of marketing of WMP, leveraging the services, events and expertise provided by strategic marketing and communications, global engagement and external stakeholders
              
              3.	Provide direction to the marketing and communications teams in the global project sites to deliver a high standard of external communications to gain community support
              
              4.	Develop and implement social media strategies to promote WMP as a leading organisation in the sector
              
              5.	Develop and implement external relationships with key stakeholders including government and industry partners
              
              6.	Provide high quality market research and analysis , including identification of potential new opportunities
              
              7.	Contribute to a range of marketing and communication projects, such as campaigns, online and offline advertising, and presentations, as required to promote WMPs work at a global level
              
              8.	Provide strategic marketing and communications advice and assistance to WMP senior managers

Yêu Cầu Công Việc
             

              EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS
              
              1.	The appointee will have:
              
              •	postgraduate qualifications or progress towards postgraduate qualifications and extensive relevant experience; or
              
              •	extensive experience and marketing expertise; or an equivalent combination of relevant experience and/or education/training
              

              KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
              
              2.	Demonstrated record of achievement and success in a marketing and communications role, preferably in an not for profit or health environment
              
              3.	Demonstrated success in acquiring and utilising market intelligence and using effective, contemporary communication channels
              
              4.	Outstanding organising and planning skills, including identifying processes, tasks and resources required to achieve a goal, prioritizing, developing and implementing systems and procedures to guide and track work progress, and recognising barriers and finding effective ways to deal with them
              
              5.	Proven ability to facilitate, develop and sustain relationships across a range of stakeholders and cultures and represent the World Mosquito Program  with a high degree of professionalism
              
              6.	Demonstrated ability to effectively influence collaborate and negotiate successful outcomes with a range of stakeholders
              
              7.	Strong commitment to the provision of high quality customer service to internal and external stakeholders
              
              8.	 Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to develop and deliver high impact presentations to diverse audiences
              
              9.	A demonstrated interest in, and desire to contribute to, the vision and values of a not for profit scientific research program
